alert.note: Alert for Allegheny (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 10 at 8:34PM EST until January 11 at 9:00PM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Ohio River At Pittsburgh affecting Allegheny County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Ohio River at Pittsburgh. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Water begins to flow onto the Monongahela Parking Wharf. At 19.0 feet, Water begins to flow onto the North Shore riverwalk between the stadiums. At 19.5 feet, The Monongahela Parking Wharf is completely flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 18.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 18.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 18.4 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall to 16.8 feet and begin rising again Saturday morning. It will rise to 18.9 feet Sunday evening. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Action stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at weather.gov/pbz.
